intro: Hibbertia covenyana, commonly known as the Covenyana devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hibbertia covenyana has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. It is a relatively rare species and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
